Articles.Content: Is it possible for a company to be an independent contractor, and sell equipment to any side that wants it? It would seem to fit well enough with what little backstory I have, a desperate manufacturer looking to create profit regardless of what consequences might arise, as well as letting HatBat choose for himself which side the craft seems better suited for, if it is selected to partake in the series.

12 hours ago, Abraxis said:

Is it possible for a company to be an independent contractor, and sell equipment to any side that wants it? It would seem to fit well enough with what little backstory I have, a desperate manufacturer looking to create profit regardless of what consequences might arise, as well as letting HatBat choose for himself which side the craft seems better suited for, if it is selected to partake in the series.

He did say this:

- Please pick a side: HKA or GMI. While it is just a recommendation, staying on the fence makes your agency/submissions harder to work with.

So independent companies that sell to both sides might not be ideal. But I suppose you could just tell HatBat to use the craft on either side, if you don't mind that

Personally, I feel like my company/submission might be a tad inconvenient because it's supposed to  be one of those 'good turned bad' examples, since the executives/CEO are GMI-sided, but the bulk of the employees lean more towards HKA, and are bound to GMI more out of fear than anything else.

Edited January 5, 2018 by Earthlinger

16 hours ago, Earthlinger said:

Mine too

turns out that the BDA version for 1.4 works fine in 1.5, so atm I have one tank destroyer in action. My computer is really struggling right now..

And now an MBT! looks like that for now the Abrams cannon is actually quite good against softer targets... Mainly because it's firing what looks to be HE right now. It flipped and killed the crew of 3 different upgraded tank destroyers... Oh, and the new ability to spawn vessels with crew in seats allows me to have actual tank crews now

Also, Making History plates seem really good as armor. The smallest plate can stop one 105mm howitzer round, and they are freaking tiny. You can fit like 4 layers of them on the front easy.

Hrmm, looks like I forgot to mention the tank destroyers... They are a box of Making history bits, some fuel exposed on the front, and a nice large sloped plate (something like 80 degrees) and a bunch of wings on the side. It's got a cool gun mount with the weapon manager being used as a gunsight in the mantlet (to simulate getting hit there murdering the tank). Armed with a .50 cal and a 105mm, this tank is (not) a real beast!! Also, it has no tracks yet so it sucks as soon as the enemy gets within 200 meters on open ground. It dies more often to the crew getting knocked out of the seat or being flipped by near misses than to actual damage (though the holes in the tanks would disagree) and that shows how light it is. Pics tomorrow!
